snippet: After three rebuilding seasons, General Manager Sandy Alderson essentially announced that the Mets, now freed of a number of burdensome contracts, could spend again.
abstract: General Manager Sandy Alderson essentially announces that the New York Mets are free of a number of burdensome contracts, and can begin to spend again; in the coming days, members of Mets management will convene and evaluate their players and decide whom they want to add in free agency or in trades and will determine the payroll for 2014.
lead_paragraph: After three rebuilding seasons, General Manager Sandy Alderson essentially announced that the Mets, now freed of a number of burdensome contracts, could spend again.

headline.main: For Mets, Financial Restraints Are Off and Pressure Is On
headline.print_headline: For Mets, Financial Restraints Are Off and Pressure Is On
